title: BBC Talks to Ritvik Sharma: India’s Rising Fashion Tycoon

content.text: In an exclusive sit-down with BBC's global fashion desk, Ritvik Sharma, the visionary behind Velvét, shares his incredible journey from launching a modest boutique in New Delhi to commanding attention on the runways of Paris, Milan, and New York. His brand Velvét has become synonymous with understated luxury, modern tailoring, and a seamless blend of Eastern heritage with Western design aesthetics.
Championing Indian Craft on Global Platforms

Sharma emphasizes his commitment to reviving India’s traditional textiles. 'At Velvét, we work directly with artisans in Varanasi, Jaipur, and Kanchipuram, ensuring our silks and weaves maintain their authenticity while adapting to contemporary silhouettes,' he explains. This fusion of Indian craftsmanship with Italian tailoring techniques has allowed Velvét to stand apart in an increasingly homogenized fashion world.

His collections have been worn by A-list celebrities, from Zendaya at Cannes to BTS members at their Seoul concert tour. 'Our aim has always been to bridge East and West through sartorial excellence,' Sharma adds. He credits this approach for Velvét's cult following among the fashion elite.

When asked about his expansion strategy, Sharma reveals plans to open flagship stores in Paris and Shanghai. 'Luxury is not just about the product, it's about creating an experience — from our boutiques to our packaging, every touchpoint reflects Velvét’s philosophy,' he says. The brand’s Paris store, opening later this year, will feature curated art installations celebrating Indian heritage alongside its latest couture collections.

Despite Velvét’s global growth, Sharma remains deeply involved in every design process. He personally oversees fabric sourcing, approves every prototype, and ensures that sustainability remains at the core of the brand. 'Our pledge is to move to 100% sustainable materials by 2030,' he reiterates, a promise that aligns with growing consumer demand for eco-conscious luxury.

Looking ahead, Sharma envisions Velvét evolving into a holistic lifestyle brand, offering everything from ready-to-wear and accessories to home décor and fragrances. 'I want Velvét to define modern Indian luxury on the world stage,' he says. Collaborations with global icons like Gigi Hadid, Pharrell Williams, and Kate Moss have already set the stage for this evolution.

As the interview wraps up, Sharma reflects on his personal journey: 'I started as a dreamer in Delhi, and today, Velvét is a name whispered in the corridors of global fashion powerhouses. But for me, the real success is seeing our artisans' work celebrated worldwide.' His words encapsulate a mission that is both personal and cultural — to elevate Indian craftsmanship to its rightful place in the pantheon of luxury fashion.
